Issues.Title: Next.js image placeholder blur attribute get updated with tailwind upgrade tool
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

4.0.1

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 15.1.6

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

23.6.1

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

1. Have a sample Next.js project with `Image` component that have placeholder attribute set to blur like so

````ts

import Image from "next/image";

export default function Avatar() { 

return (
        <Image
            width={40}
            height={40}
            src={guideImage}
            placeholder="blur"
            quality={50}
            priority={true}
            alt={`${chatSettings.voice} avatar`}
            className="h-10 w-10 rounded-full bg-base-100"
        />
    );

}

````

2. Run the npx @tailwindcss/upgrade@next 
3. Endup with code like so 

````ts
import Image from "next/image";

export default function Avatar() { 

return (
        <Image
            width={40}
            height={40}
            src={guideImage}
            placeholder="blur-sm"  <-- it's mistaked for CSS class
            quality={50}
            priority={true}
            alt={`${chatSettings.voice} avatar`}
            className="h-10 w-10 rounded-full bg-base-100"
        />
    );

}
````

**Describe your issue**

Upgrading tool is mistaking a placeholder blur attribute with CSS class.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Next.js image placeholder blur attribute get updated with tailwind upgrade tool" (#16028)

Issues.Title: Do not scan `tailwind-merge` sources for candidates
Issues.Body:
Resolves #15722

This PR adds a list of ignored dependencies (in the current form only `tailwind-merge`) to the Vite extension which, when included in the dependency tree, are no longer scanned by the Tailwind CSS compiler for candidates. This is to work around an issue where some dependencies contain vast lists of valid Tailwind CSS class names which would otherwise always be inlined in the build.

Issues.Title: [v4] variants are not working on layer defined components and utilities
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v4.0.0

**Reproduction URL**

v3.4.15 - https://play.tailwindcss.com/t7YcGka233
v4.0.0 - https://play.tailwindcss.com/KCVjmX1VxW

Following style should be applied, works for v3 not for v4
```css
@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .x-button:is(.md\:square) {
    --x-button-padding-block: 0;
    --x-button-padding-inline: 0;
    --x-button-inline-size: var(--x-button-block-size);
  }
}
```

**Describe your issue**

Previously on v3 components and utilities could be defined via layers, this was also recommended in docs ([v4](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/adding-custom-styles#adding-component-classes), [v3](https://v3.tailwindcss.com/docs/adding-custom-styles#adding-component-classes)). 

Variants worked on these classes, not anymore in v4. Some UI frameworks for TailwindCSS use this for component variants, eg. [DaisyUI](https://daisyui.com/components/button/#responsive-button) or [Winduum](https://winduum.dev/docs/components/button.html).

Eg: responsive button
```html
// DaisyUI
<button class="btn btn-xs sm:btn-sm md:btn-md lg:btn-lg">Responsive</button>

// Winduum
<button class="x-button md:square">Button</button>
```

[DaisyUI v5](https://github.com/saadeghi/daisyui/blob/v5/packages/daisyui/index.js) solves this limitation in v4 by importing styles via javascript plugin. [Winduum](https://winduum.dev/docs/) tries to use CSS only configuration for v4, and [every component](https://github.com/winduum/winduum/tree/main/src/components/button) is compatibile with native CSS.

Winduum v2.1 supports TailwindCSS v4 completely, but this is the only current limitation, which is not in TailwindCSS v3.

I understand that alternative is to newly define everything via `@utility`, but that is limitng and not backward compatible with v3.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[v4] variants are not working on layer defined components and utilities" (#16000)

Issues.Title: [v4] CDN utility classes don't work if there's existing styles in page
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.0.0

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

https://unpkg.com/@tailwindcss/browser@4

**Reproduction URL**

https://codepen.io/saadeghi/pen/qEWgRem?editors=1000

**Describe your issue**

Using the previous CDN file `https://cdn.tailwindcss.com` all utility classes used to work regardless of existing styles in page.  
For example in this code, `p-10 m-10` used to override the existing style.
```html
<button class="p-10 m-10 bg-red-300">Button</button>

<style>
  * {
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
  }
</style>
```
Now using `https://unpkg.com/@tailwindcss/browser@4` it doesn't work anymore. Apparently the styles injected by the CDN file have the lowest importance.

**Expected behavior**
Utility classes are expected to have higher priority than existing styles, similar to how `https://cdn.tailwindcss.com` used to work.  
Or at least there should be a config for it.  

**Why it matters**

I understand CDN file is not for production, but there are many development-stage projects out there using the CDN file and I guess updating `https://cdn.tailwindcss.com` to `https://unpkg.com/@tailwindcss/browser@4` will break many of them.

Issues.Body:
The CDN version also includes the `$()` function starting from v4.0.0, so it's quite interesting to work with jQuery. Although, for me, this is a bizarre combination, I noticed the issue on StackOverflow: [TailwindCSS v4 Play CDN not working with jQuery](https://stackoverflow.com/a/79394252/15167500)

### Reproduction#01

```html
<script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.6.0.min.js"></script>
<script src="https://unpkg.com/@tailwindcss/browser@4"></script>
```

```js
$(document).ready(function () {
  alert("Hello world");
});
```

> Uncaught TypeError: $(...).ready is not a function

### Reproduction#02

```html
<script src="https://unpkg.com/@tailwindcss/browser@4"></script>
```

```js
console.log($)
```

> ```
> function $(t,r,o){return P("@property",t,[a("syntax",o?`"${o}"`:'"*"'),a("inherits","false"),...r?[a("initial-value",r)]:[]])}
> ```

It doesn't have much of an impact on me, so I haven't tested whether this affects the npm package, but my initial assumption is that it doesn't. I just wanted to mention the incompatibility between the CDN and jQuery.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[v4] CDN jQuery compatibility" (#15977)
